name: Human History Museum
description: Indoor exhibits focus in the human history of Zion National Park. A 22-minute orientation film highlights the dramatic landscapes of the park and examines the history of the canyon. Rotating art exhibits feature regional artists. Visit the bookstore for maps, book, and gifts. There are dramatic views of the Towers of the Virgin and Bridge Mountain outside.

images.title: Human History Museum
images.altText: A brick building with mountains in the background
images.caption: Human History Museum

images.title: Human History Museum Shuttle Stop
images.altText: Shuttle Stop sign on a sidewalk with a shuttle bus in the background
images.caption: Human History Museum Shuttle Stop

images.caption: Human History Museum Exhibits

images.title: Human History Museum

images.title: Towers and Temples from the Museum back patio
images.altText: A sign describing the view of a large rock formation in the background
images.caption: One of the most famous views in the park can be seen from the back patio at the Museum.

operatingHours.description: Open daily from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. The Zion Canyon Shuttle only stops here going toward the Zion Canyon Visitor Center (down canyon). Shuttles to the Temple of Sinawava (up canyon) do not stop here.
operatingHours.name: Human History Museum

name: Kolob Canyons Visitor Center
description: Closed daily from 12pm-1pm This is the entry point to the Kolob Canyons area of the park. It is located 45 miles north of Springdale and 17 miles south of Cedar City at Exit 40 on Interstate 15. Park rangers are available to answer questions. Exhibits explore the geology, vegetation, and wildlife of this unique landscape.

images.title: Kolob Canyons Entrance Sign
images.altText: A stone monument with a wooden sign the says Kolob Canyons - Zion National Park
images.caption: The Kolob Canyons Entrance Monument is near the visitor center.

operatingHours.description:
All guests are required to stop at the Kolob Canyons Visitor Center to show an Interagency Park Pass or pay the Zion National Park entrance fee. There is also a bookstore operated by the Zion Natl Park Forever Project. Closed daily from 12 p.m. - 1 p.m. for lunch.

Wilderness permits cannot be picked up here. Please go to the Zion Canyon Visitor Center for all Wilderness permits.
operatingHours.name: Kolob Canyons Visitor Center

name: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
description: Located near the South Entrance of the park, the Zion Canyon Visitor Center is an excellent place to begin your exploration of Zion Canyon. Park rangers and outdoor exhibits will help you plan your visit and make the most of your time. Inquire at the Zion Canyon Wilderness Desk about permits for backpacking, canyoneering, and other trips into the wilderness. Visit the bookstore for maps, books, and gifts.

images.title: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
images.altText: Zion Canyon Visitor Center sits among yellow cottonwood trees in the fall.
images.caption: Zion Canyon Visitor Center

images.title: Zion Canyon Visitor Center
images.altText: Zion Canyon Visitor Center has two stone cooling towers and shrubs outside.
images.caption: Zion Canyon Visitor Center

images.title: Outdoor Information Tents
images.altText: Two white canopies outside the visitor center buildling
images.caption: During pandemic operations, visitor services are provided outside.

images.title: Outdoor Exhibits
images.altText: A concrete plaza area with wooden shelters covering park exhibits.
images.caption: The visitor center exhibits are available 24 hours a day.

operatingHours.description: The Zion Canyon Visitor Center is open every day of the year, with longer hours from May through September.
operatingHours.name: Zion Canyon Visitor Center

emailAddresses.description: All your park questions, including Visitor Center information can be answered at this address.
